interp_exp_decay#

interp_exp_decay(prev_data: Tensor, next_data: Tensor, sample_at: Tensor, step_time: float, /, *, time_constant: float) → Tensor[source]#

Interpolates by exponentially decaying value from previous state.

\[D_{t=s} = D_{t=0} \exp\left(-\frac{s}{\tau}\right)\]
Parameters:

  • prev_data (torch.Tensor) – most recent observation prior to sample time, \(D_{t=0}\).

  • next_data (torch.Tensor) – most recent observation subsequent to sample time, \(D_{t=T}\).

  • sample_at (torch.Tensor) – relative time at which to sample data, \(s\).

  • step_data (float) – length of time between the prior and subsequent observations, \(T\).

  • time_constant (float) – time constant of exponential decay, \(tau\).

Returns:

interpolated data at sample time, \(D_{t=s}\).

Return type:

torch.Tensor
